lines.text: [Cash and Jeff rescue a baby from a deserted wagon]
What have we got that'll feed his gizzard? He can't chaw jerky!
Aw, you don't know nothin'. There's oatmeal gruel and a mite of bacon grease'll see him through.
Well, Dad, if they think they're going water cattle here tonight, here's two Winchesters who'll say they ain't!
Miss, I'm from Montana and I'm headin' New Mexico way.
What was your name in Montana?
Brett - same as here! And I'm headin' New Mexico way. At least I was

Mary Ellen, look out there across the desert. As far as you can see, way off there in the distance... you see those big lonesome pinnacles? When I was a little boy, I used to lie out there evenings, watching the shadows pass over 'em. I used to imagine they were all sorts of things... dragons fighting... giants lying there sleeping... and great big monsters that might come down after it got dark and get me.

[giggle]
I know. I used to think that way, too.
Over it? Sure! As soon as I knew what they really was - just big rocks.
But before that, you were a little bit afraid of them, weren't you?

Well, it's just like that with folks. A way off in the distance of your mind there's a terrible man called Cash Holbrook. To you, he's been one of those awful monsters you used to imagine. But I've been up close to him - in the daylight - and to me, he's been a kind man... and mighty good.
